**Blade Hands** is a level 5 [Transmutations](/Transmutations "Transmutations") spell that greatly increased your damage in [Unarmed Combat](/Unarmed_Combat "Unarmed Combat").

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [2.1 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [3 History](#History)

## Useful Info

Casting this spell gives you the Blade Hands status for a spellpower-dependent duration. You'll gain the following:

**Combat Bonuses**

- **[Unarmed Combat](/Unarmed_Combat "Unarmed Combat"):** 22 base damage.
- Your [off-hand punch](/Auxiliary_attack "Auxiliary attack") gains +6 damage.

**Restrictions**

- **[Melded Gear](/Transformation#Useful_Info "Transformation"):** [Weapon](/Weapon "Weapon"), [shield](/Shield "Shield"), and [gloves](/Gloves "Gloves"). [Claws](/Claws "Claws") are also melded.
- You can't [throw](/Throw "Throw") items.
- Makes spells harder to cast (increases [raw spell failure](/Spell_Success#Modifiers "Spell Success") rate by +20%).

Blade Hands does not block [mutations](/Mutation "Mutation") (other than claws), does not change your [size](/Size "Size"), and gives no innate bonus to HP / [AC](/AC "AC"). It is considered its own [form](/Form "Form"), so it'll end other statuses like [Ice Form](/Ice_Form "Ice Form") or [Dragon Form](/Dragon_Form "Dragon Form").

## Strategy

Blade Hands is essentially [two-handed](/Hand "Hand") Unarmed Combat. Even at 0 Unarmed Combat skill, you'll hit as hard as a [giant spiked club](/Giant_spiked_club "Giant spiked club"), while keeping the off-hand punch and swinging faster. It's certainly strong. However, the spell takes quite a bit of investment to get running, especially if you want to use heavy [body armour](/Body_armour "Body armour"). And if you're in light armour, then your defenses will be low.

### Tips & Tricks

- Like all slashing attacks, Blade Hands is a terrible choice for fighting [hydras](/Hydra "Hydra").
- This spell will meld away even [cursed](/Cursed "Cursed") weapons, allowing [Ashenzari](/Ashenzari "Ashenzari") worshipers to have their hands bound and still use Unarmed Combat.

## History

- Blade Hands was replaced with the [Blade talisman](/Blade_talisman "Blade talisman") in [0.31](/0.31 "0.31").
- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), Blade Hands could be found in the [Book of Changes](/Book_of_Changes "Book of Changes"), and thus the [Transmuter](/Transmuter "Transmuter") start. This spell also lowered [felids](/Felid "Felid")' [stealth](/Stealth "Stealth").
- Prior to [0.22](/0.22 "0.22"), Blade Hands, and most other transformations, prevented usage of [wands](/Wand "Wand").
- Prior to [0.20](/0.20 "0.20"), Blade Hands' base damage scaled with [strength](/Strength "Strength") and [dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity") (`8 + (str + dex) / 3`).
- Prior to [0.10](/0.10 "0.10"), Blade Hands had higher base damage and lower dependence on stats.

Causes long, scythe-shaped blades to grow from the caster's hands, increasing melee damage significantly.

While transformed, any equipped weapons are melded, and casting spells becomes somewhat more difficult.

Blade Hands is a level 5 Transmutations spell that greatly increased your damage in Unarmed Combat.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Strategy
    • 2.1 Tips & Tricks
  • 3 History

Useful Info

Casting this spell gives you the Blade Hands status for a spellpower-dependent duration. You'll gain the following:

Combat Bonuses

  • Unarmed Combat: 22 base damage.
  • Your off-hand punch gains +6 damage.

Restrictions

  • Melded Gear: Weapon, shield, and gloves. Claws are also melded.
  • You can't throw items.
  • Makes spells harder to cast (increases raw spell failure rate by +20%).

Blade Hands does not block mutations (other than claws), does not change your size, and gives no innate bonus to HP / AC. It is considered its own form, so it'll end other statuses like Ice Form or Dragon Form.

Strategy

Blade Hands is essentially two-handed Unarmed Combat. Even at 0 Unarmed Combat skill, you'll hit as hard as a giant spiked club, while keeping the off-hand punch and swinging faster. It's certainly strong. However, the spell takes quite a bit of investment to get running, especially if you want to use heavy body armour. And if you're in light armour, then your defenses will be low.

Tips & Tricks

  • Like all slashing attacks, Blade Hands is a terrible choice for fighting hydras.
  • This spell will meld away even cursed weapons, allowing Ashenzari worshipers to have their hands bound and still use Unarmed Combat.

History

  • Blade Hands was replaced with the Blade talisman in 0.31.
  • Prior to 0.27, Blade Hands could be found in the Book of Changes, and thus the Transmuter start. This spell also lowered felids' stealth.
  • Prior to 0.22, Blade Hands, and most other transformations, prevented usage of wands.
  • Prior to 0.20, Blade Hands' base damage scaled with strength and dexterity (8 + (str + dex) / 3).
  • Prior to 0.10, Blade Hands had higher base damage and lower dependence on stats.
